00084 /* ImageUser is in Texture, in Nodes, Background Image, Image Window, .... */
00085 /* should be used in conjunction with an ID * to Image. */
00086 struct ImageUser;
00087 struct RenderPass;
00088 struct RenderResult;
00089 
00090 /* ima->source; where image comes from */
00091 #define IMA_SRC_CHECK       0
00092 #define IMA_SRC_FILE        1
00093 #define IMA_SRC_SEQUENCE    2
00094 #define IMA_SRC_MOVIE       3
00095 #define IMA_SRC_GENERATED   4
00096 #define IMA_SRC_VIEWER      5
00097 
00098 /* ima->type, how to handle/generate it */
00099 #define IMA_TYPE_IMAGE      0
00100 #define IMA_TYPE_MULTILAYER 1
00101         /* generated */
00102 #define IMA_TYPE_UV_TEST    2
00103         /* viewers */
00104 #define IMA_TYPE_R_RESULT   4
00105 #define IMA_TYPE_COMPOSITE  5
00106 
00107 /* ima->ok */
00108 #define IMA_OK              1
00109 #define IMA_OK_LOADED       2
00110 
00111 /* signals */
00112     /* reload only frees, doesn't read until image_get_ibuf() called */
00113 #define IMA_SIGNAL_RELOAD           0
00114 #define IMA_SIGNAL_FREE             1
00115     /* source changes, from image to sequence or movie, etc */
00116 #define IMA_SIGNAL_SRC_CHANGE       5
00117     /* image-user gets a new image, check settings */
00118 #define IMA_SIGNAL_USER_NEW_IMAGE   6
00119 
00120 #define IMA_CHAN_FLAG_BW    1
00121 #define IMA_CHAN_FLAG_RGB   2
00122 #define IMA_CHAN_FLAG_ALPHA 4

00124 /* depending Image type, and (optional) ImageUser setting it returns ibuf */
00125 /* always call to make signals work */
00126 struct ImBuf *BKE_image_get_ibuf(struct Image *ima, struct ImageUser *iuser);
00127

00129  * a thread safe way, always call both acquire and release */

00131 void BKE_image_release_ibuf(struct Image *ima, void *lock);
